document.title: Archdiocese of Chicago Catholic School Standards

FC233D72E2D546FB9707A5FE7938AB36.description: Describe the Orthodox Church as the eastern church resulting from the Great Schism.

4550CDBED57747FD93676B29B2EAC785.description: Name Lutheran, Episcopal, Baptist, Methodist an Apostolic churches as some of thechurches evolved from the time of the Reformation.

499A3409708148B28C1A925218D91AF7.description: Describe how anti-Semitism began and how Catholics do not engage in any form of anti-Semitism today.

B9AE4175E1A9423EBB9371AE4B2F8109.description: Identify the life of present day Judaism as organized around the synagogue and the rabbi.

43FB28E3C8A840F0A4C784C40FC9D128.description: State the religious holy days of  Eid al-Fitr, at the end of Ramadan, and Eid al-Adha.

9DC36BE1814E48409B93988BB763AF64.description: Describe the Five Pillars of Islam.

ABC70E1D19EA4849A983E3D3CE72E868.description: Recognize the growth of Islam as a world religion, its contributions to culture and world peace.

7DADBBDF66C24AF3B2D659DDE558CA79.description: Show that ecumenism and dialogue are evangelizing works of the Church in the task of creating unity and peace in the world.

C9C377E9F8D04620943E4E136BDE33E4.description: State that catechists respond to a specific call of the Church to witness and teach the Gospel.

85B22707664E4B5F910A097D99ADD167.description: Know the different calls in the Church as vocation

9403ED258F334A438FA885EF0E7E428A.description: Recognize the Church’s understanding of vocation as a call from God to engage in the mission of the Church.

806F39016C69493A8F2C5EFE8C954B5B.description: State that every Catholic has a vocation.

5926FD7D3F2C4C508A7FF4E40979B04E.description: Recognize that every baptized Catholic has a specific call from the Holy Spirit to be lived in the life of the Church.

F2ABF9C8DD55472B924792C261C1FA76.description: State the cultural, racial and ethnic diversity of the parish as gifts that enrich the entire community.

D03A197B4254404D985472AEE87429DA.description: Show understanding of the organizational structure of the parish.

B90A553353B443FB86535D463F3BC631.description: Describe stewardship in parish life as giving my time, talent, and treasure as a response of gratitude to the treasury of blessings God gives to me.

3EBF679D191043329274558086E11675.description: Show understanding of stewardship as a spiritual commitment to taking responsibility for global environmental and human concerns.

4209C6B5F68B487C91D25A742DE8981B.description: Recognize that my life as a confirmed Catholic is actively lived in the parish.

EFE82807E4D645C38DEE0E5217C29EA0.description: Show understanding and commitment to the Church and its service to the poor.

A2113C049925423E9F98F05A8826D7CB.description: State the understanding of the Church as the Body of Christ, the  Pilgrim Church and the Church as Sacrament as images of the Church expressed in the encyclicals and documents of modern popes an the Vatican II Council.

4372E4B4E7514AE19F81B72FBA8DBC13.description: Show understanding that the Catholic Church from early times until the present responds to the Holy Spirit through reform and inner conversion.

3F202BAB5EAB4D77BA24ABE8DC48D846.description: Show understanding of the leadership role of Pope John Paul II in the Church and the world through the call for a new evangelization.

6F87FE7207DF46108A43868A18EAD2B4.description: Recount the Vatican II Council as the ecumenical council leading the Catholic Church into a place of spiritual leadership in modern society, addressing particularly the work of ecumenism and religious dialogue, the role of bishops in subsidiarity, and the current challenges of the Church in the era of global economics and quest for peace.

1062B407AB7A44F5B489905E77C92654.description: Describe the Age of the Modern Church beginning in 1890 as a sign of hope for society undergoing vast change through the rise and fall of totalitarian governments.

BFD9FB4BE6394A3892E8664AF17A4F24.description: Show understanding of the growth of missionary orders in the Church, the establishment of dioceses in the New World, the rise of anti-Catholicism, the rise of Deism, and the Age of Enlightenment, the growth of apostolic religious life, the popes in the Modern Age.

F3A69F9EE65F4D84BC464EEF1D0EBEB4.description: Show understanding of the causes of the Reformation, the  rise of Protestantism and the Counter-Reformation of the Catholic Church to begin the inner work of reform begun in the Council of Trent in the Age of Reform from 1517 to 1891 CE.

CD6AC0291E8147A18F26702FB3E568D2.description: State the challenges to the Church in the later Medieval Period, the move of the papacy to France, the Renaissance and Christian humanism.

E5FC172062134B2294CB0D7C562814A9.description: State the Eastern Rites as rites of the Catholic Church faithful to the Pope.

46CBD936450B4E3597E0D7B69F3C1FD9.description: Identify the major events during the Age of Medieval Europe from 700to 1500CE, the Romanization of the papacy and its effects, the contribution of Charlemagne Emperor of the Roman Empire to the peace of Europe, the Crusades, the claiming of land for religion, the Black Death, the architecture an art of Medieval Europe and their influence on the building of cathedrals, the role of the Inquisition, the Great Schism resulting in the split between Eastern and Western Christianity, the rise of the mendicant religious orders as a way to reform the Church.

0930D031F16A4190874102D066B4F64C.description: State other world events during the Age of Expansion and the  evangelization of Europe.

1E266CF44B624E7D8D550705ED6037C1.description: Identify main events of the Church’s Age of Expansion from 313-700 CE beginning with the Edict of Toleration, the organization of the Church after the persecutions, the decisions of the ecumenical councils, the expansion of the Church across Europe through missionary activity, and the growth of monasticism.

4803DE1B43474A0E950BF610059F95B1.description: Identify the early period of the Church from 30 CE to 313 CE including the Apostolic Age, the role of deacons and deaconesses, Roman persecutions, move from Jewish to Gentile membership, the contributions of the early fathers, and the importance of councils.

EFB7A9A7634B4D3086502D7ECEA4812D.description: Recognize that the Church’s gifts and growth are evident through all periods of history in the last 2000 years.

C3966B6E6A1B4975AB1DE3CCC91877D7.description: Describe the origin of the Church at the time of Pentecost.

BAC79D2035A049F08BF1CFF07C6081B5.description: Identify that the Pope, as the visible head of the Church, is a world leader to whom people look for inspiration, guidance, and hope.

42B750140E7D48659D889CACF7DD31A6.description: Show understanding that the Church is a sign to the world of its salvation in Christ.

C9F52364846047438CD0D76C1BBA3BE1.description: Recognize that the members of the Church have contributed and have undermined the mission throughout her history.

343B3FEC13AB40D5A28BE85719BC08C1.description: The Church has special charisms that she receives from the Holy Spirit to accomplish its work.

C7D83C99FBB34F31A4D7D77F54A6ACD1.description: Show understanding that the Church is a living institution, both human and divine, gifted by the holy Spirit with a mission to the world.

FB89FECCB4C84684906F7468D0A1113D.description: State that the Church prays for both the living and the dead.

60E1C42D8FE841A9893BF9DE7EDFB6AD.description: Describe how prayer leads to peaceful attitude.

BF34AE698E3E4B0F8E705CB6C212E633.description: Recognize the Liturgy of the Hours as a prayer form that Christians of all states in life may pray.

6DA36B30216D4F2FAF822B729818CF80.description: Exhibit facility in finding psalms in the Bible and choosing appropriate psalms for group prayer.

6B307E5677F84CC28F67A2BDD0981BDC.description: State that Christians pray the way Jesus prayed.

5CE1D6E4BC154341975BCBB7D9FD59BA.description: Show understanding that prayer is a way of life.

6F556B872ABA48DBA4BC6D5E92462694.description: Identify psalms used in the Gospel of Luke and the Acts of the Apostles.

3B2B86E5C15F46208777AA041BA8FADD.description: Describe how the gifts of the Holy Spirit are essential to Christian spiritual life.

47443BAC49704C9281F56D89E315B3C8.description: Exhibit facility in praying to the Holy Spirit as a sign of awareness that the Holy Spirit is at work in me.

FF7047A269D748BE83B4D1E397BBE453.description: Name the special signs of the bishop: the miter, crosier, pectoral cross and ring.

92FFFAA1E3FE4E078E05045710F56555.description: Show understanding of public devotion in parish life especially Eucharistic adoration and benediction.

EE98FE2B2ACF4B8180B4A69E327892F5.description: Show understanding that the Eucharist is the source and summit of the Christian life.

83D82A98A0174968B30010BD7B7DEFC1.description: Show understanding of the roles of the priest and deacon in the Mass.

790C4BF159834F388A1E6787998F6DCA.description: Identify devotional and artistic symbols in the church.

8908600B931142ADB0F4B06C8E5EFC13.description: Identify the vestments used in liturgical celebrations and their use.

4AD4089781394F50A4CC291AA99B4C8C.description: Identify the vessels and other common objects used in liturgical rites and their use.

1BB67A12D76C4A39BE83C000A2053522.description: Identify the symbols used in the church.

13B1B7C0F2AC43D6B4D60B489F0230A7.description: Recognize the different areas of the church an their significance.

9BB38967A267402A9818489B7C0AAE2F.description: Show an understanding of the liturgical colors and their significance in the liturgical year.

E04A138AACE5445FBFC35E5204A03304.description: Show an understanding of the liturgical year.

8EE94E6E4E5944799A6F5F54A114256C.description: Show understanding of all parts of the Mass and the role of the assembly.

510B055D0AA9488D9457CFD7925B41EA.description: Show understanding that all participating in the liturgical rites have particular roles.

283A05C3151B495A9026EE40CAFC2793.description: Describe how the stories of the early Christian movement help us to understand the beginnings of the Church.

6B16EE688CA54B208D1E40DFABF1855A.description: Describe why letters are incorporated into Sacred Scripture.

25B082C09BFD4E82BDC18CDA457B5505.description: Recount the gathering of the Council of Jerusalem and the question about circumcision.

B060E813CC7A4666A4A4C91DA8C923AE.description: Recount the story of Peter’s acceptance of Gentiles into baptism and the first missionary journey of Paul.

A9209290DF624E84A254C2DC92A6043B.description: Recount the mission in Judea an Samaria led by Peter and Saul’s conversion.

444D8B37C7854154A969D736CA7707DA.description: State the significance of the story of Stephen in the Acts of the Apostles.

15BDDC26359E49C7908F9C68A0EAA710.description: State the role of the first deacons and which community they were called to serve.

928A1E5C3DFB4244A3F92C42B8EF86E0.description: Recount the mission of the first witnesses in Jerusalem led by Peter.

89525FD5DA4C4897B1B72D6032DB41F0.description: Describe the preparation period for the mission, the replacement of Judas and Peter’s leadership, Jesus’ leaving and the role of the Holy Spirit.

66E5AF64A8D240C3AA9F283589162B28.description: Describe the Prologue of the Acts of the Apostles as the introduction to Acts and description of the purpose of the account.

84532D3443B2477382E52182CB677044.description: Identify the Holy Spirit received by the disciples at Pentecost as the major figure in the Acts of the Apostles enlivening the establishment of the Church after the ascension of Jesus.

DF253739AA93408DAE2F35001BE9E0B9.description: State the structure of the Acts of the Apostles.

DA828A45D7224AB9A3832FE9026E7340.description: State the literary style of the Acts of the Apostles including  Hellenistic (Greek) historiography.

A3306C2B988D42D98727A0439C54459F.description: Show familiarity with the Acts of the Apostles.

07261F9223DB4A0A915F506FC88A4001.description: Show familiarity with the geography and principal cities of the Middle Eastern world and Rome.

725F11BC0FDA49BD9A8438C6F0A74436.description: Explain that the author of the Gospel of Luke also wrote the Acts of the Apostles.

E08354AC88D645FE83B73AA81E01988C.description: Recognize that to discover the scripture author’s intention the reader must take into account the culture, history and literary forms of that time.

D18854167CF54262A063550C082AE414.description: Show understanding that Sacred Scripture and Tradition make up a single deposit of the Word of God.

5F120466628243388F2FD4CD3B50EF3C.description: Identify three categories of the spiritual sense of Scripture:  allegorical, moral, and anagogical.

C911439F3430435C822875A4427FBA85.description: Name and describe the two senses of Scripture: literal and spiritual.

EF3A2088B5B5444295920536215A4344.description: Recognize the Holy Spirit as central to opening the eyes of those who read scripture and moving them to have faith in God.

99F9CABAADE04254B2B8A18BD7474CF9.description: Identify the fruits of the Holy Spirit as signs of the Christian life.

77F3C203CB2B4CF2B08F818578AACF1B.description: Show understanding that the Christian life requires preferential love for the poor.

E9F65BDF65254ED4885244EF4D4CE26C.description: Recognize that the Holy Spirit guides Christians to set their hearts on the Kingdom of God rather than on material riches.

1CCE335A86B6459480C34B89C6042BE6.description: State that God’s sanctifying grace helps us to seek holiness by our free response to doing God’s will in living the Christian life.

DBEDEB7E6B80457C9B02A04221F12373.description: State meaning of justification as a gift from God and not merited by human endeavor.

53FD6132C6174F488C51B2448A90AD27.description: Recognize that the Church has a right and duty to teach moral truth.

1C468E9C29AD4FE8A6256D9F49169775.description: State the conditions for abortion being a grave sin.

7BC193BA8085464E8C7CABF12C1ACCC0.description: State the Church’s teaching that human life begins with conception and ends with natural death.

1D1CC060C790435A90639C11E22FA119.description: Describe the relationship between having the right to private property and the common good.

A06D119F6BC54BEBB6F528A901873526.description: Recognize that the legitimate use of the death penalty is practically non-existent.

C3FCE844AD9B4F079E437DEBBD9DCD07.description: Show understanding that legitimate defense is a grave duty for whoever is responsible for the lives of others or the common good.

B81C28BF61A4433B8F6C3A31BDAE907A.description: Recognize that citizens are obliged in conscience not to follow the directives of civil authorities when they are against the moral order.

64A5F202932E4210ABE1B0B02C4D3457.description: Show understanding that Catholic citizens have the duty to work with civil authority for building up a just society.

95953BB10F994DC0BFC59E4A77B1CEE6.description: State how natural law expresses the dignity of the person and is the basis for fundamental rights and duties.

D4E394105FC645EEA70CFCF217382AEA.description: Describe the common good as the sum total of social conditions allowing people to reach their fulfillment.

FE641C3B57994529A60460F7F980A8BE.description: State that we transform society by implementing the Church’s Social Teaching.

CB2CF78B3D9B41EF97DD600E5C0FD62C.description: Recognize that to receive God’s mercy and forgiveness we must admit our sins.

68137F20D522445290A6E54759F3688C.description: State acts that are inherently and seriously wrong.

281511E9E25C4E1DB22E846A820FB056.description: Recognize that some acts are wrong no matter how good the end or intention.

5A522E713F2E421987F9A567A6DB73E6.description: State that conscience is a judgment of reason that helps us see the moral quality of an action.

769ED2069DE5420FAC410D8D77874F93.description: Describe human freedom as a force for growth and maturity.

A0104FA5CCA646FAA2CEADF8907AC538.description: Recognize that we are created in the image and likeness of God.

407EACB5D1E94951BA6F6345C2C281D3.description: State the sacraments in service of communion and mission.

E3224698D643406C83F2DC003BEA5188.description: Show understanding that because Christ is at work in the sacraments, they are effective independent of the disposition or holiness of the priest.

993A230557CA4F3E8F735CE29F02DC15.description: State that the bishop blesses the oils used for the sacraments including chrism for the Sacrament of Confirmation.

E2C59562B7CB418084727EDB1BB3B4B9.description: State that in the Sacrament of Holy Orders the bishop ordains priests and deacons as co-workers with him in serving the people of God.

2D73A6BC872A478D8396707A8367D9C5.description: State understanding of the permanence of sacramental marriage.

F0DDBF0448C94D498A9AFE710D594C40.description: Show understanding of the effects of Christian marriage.

AA2DEAEFA2F943DA94FF27863C6CFCBD.description: Show understanding that Christian marriage is a sign of Christ’s love for the Church.

9404DF86F59143178362DEC64329E64B.description: State that sacramental marriage consists of a man and woman freely pronouncing vows agreeing to share their lives in fruitful love.

76669215E615463AB45C18020C0942FF.description: Show understanding that the entire assembly make up the Body of Christ.

60FE1191FD004E8E9EA7A7BA677A9084.description: State that the essential elements of the Mass make up one complete act of worship.

93496ABABA7C467E9A561C9943A2468D.description: State the meaning of transubstantiation in the Holy Eucharist.

196C05D1B5674A9E9E39C393A55C9132.description: State that the Sacrament of Penance/ Reconciliation provides a means to ongoing conversion and renewal in the Christian life.

49590DA2C71A41D584CB2B60143C5AD5.description: Describe the meaning of the anointing with chrism in the Sacrament of Confirmation.

DB79D99DCA6C40D8A622D1CA366C70E3.description: State significance of the laying on of hands in relationship to the Sacrament of Confirmation and to scripture.

C1823728423A4366B8D8EE7BE5CBCB07.description: Show understanding of the importance of the presentation of the candidates.

B778C0B03EA44829BB1491DE9D2F5E48.description: Be familiar with the order of the Rite of Confirmation.

85E74CEC58284BC080BC1806DF1584FB.description: Complete the immediate preparation for receiving the Sacrament o Confirmation.

90AF112D808F417D97D7733F53B93015.description: Recognize the bishop as the ordinary minister of the Sacrament of Confirmation.

5274DE0192FB47BB945C31B97C997152.description: Show understanding that the Sacrament of Confirmation strengthens our bond with the Church and her mission.

FC83261131DC40AA8E7E9D9DA401905E.description: Select the name of a saint or holy person as the Confirmation name.

F8C29289B33444C584895A5D92338968.description: Choose a baptized Catholic to be your sponsor for Confirmation.

5CA928DFC3414EDF8248A9EF4F38D76D.description: State the gifts of the Holy Spirit and their meaning in the Christian life.

8B0708747AF14482BE382AD0B8281F57.description: State the essential elements of the Sacrament of Confirmation

1864795B3C1444158C4CC49CD187AE19.description: State the requirements for validly receiving the Sacrament of Confirmation.

8DD64374DEF8420AB0007969AA7E2CF1.description: Show understanding that every baptized person can and should receive the Sacrament of Confirmation.

971E221ED3C34A42AE5C2B5880D234DE.description: Recognize Confirmation as a sacrament of initiation carrying an indelible character sealing the confirmands with  the Gift of the Holy Spirit.

7FD0AE3F243C4172B4F0B71799403453.description: State the conditions for being saved without Baptism.

917BA0504F0940C2AD0FF61C659AD359.description: State the conditions for Baptism being necessary for salvation.

EA8032E54BE846A594A41B8D25CF05EF.description: Recognize that the benefits of the sacramental life are personal and ecclesial.

8219866B66A44818B37390C223587278.description: Describe how we pray and work for the coming of the Kingdom, but its fullness only comes at the end of time.

18A6E5243CF840E99E6DDA25574EFF12.description: Recognize that Mary collaborate with the whole redemptive work of her Son.

2406E266389846CC99E3CCBD932B76F5.description: Recognize that God gives us only one life, unique and unrepeatable, that when we die in God’s friendship we live forever in union with God in heaven.

956A3FA322954C2FACDBCC40D7E64B3B.description: State belief that Jesus’ death saves all people even though they do not know Christ.

BD0B2A466437475EB9CA6B950D6F13E8.description: State belief that Jesus died for our sins opening the possibility of eternal union with God.

6752CF4CAB084C9A91CAA00ED9017504.description: Show understanding that the whole of Jesus’ life, death and resurrection is the fulfillment of revelation.

E3F38431DFFA4972947619EC33B0BF9D.description: State the Incarnation is the mystery of the union of the divine and human natures in Jesus Christ.

61CFF594F5C446279D9E406B92A4C795.description: Recognize that God’s permitting evil is a mystery that God helps us to understand through his Son Jesus Christ.

1D63F3F43E5743AA94EDFE7FA828B309.description: State the meaning of original sin.

B1EFA967CEBB495DBDC34BAA2614DADE.description: State that God created us in a state of original holiness and justice.

2BF071ADE1AE4F33ABFB3B5602FEDCCE.description: Show how faith helps me to face the hardships of suffering, disappointment and tragedy.

3717F08052A44F3AB39F5086C06E955C.description: Show understanding that there is no contradiction between faith and reason.

508E123842DE47AC926FD89A8A8FDB96.description: State how the desire for God is written in the human heart because we are created by God and for God.

FEE675F7062A4E8182205DE96BBDA882.description: Describe how we are attracted to the grandeur and beauty of God as we see this in creation.

C079F839E386437E828E9FAFDC4F7927.description: Articulate understanding that god is holy and completely deserving of our love and worship.

B9702FD937AC472D9B73BBA16DCF70CA.description: Show understanding of God as transcendent.

B4D8B2B6CBA54C6BA3C2B0A41F624F91.description: Show understanding that the mystery of the Holy Trinity is central to the mystery of the Christian faith and of Christian life.
